Key Match Events: Jackson Chourio delivered a fifth-inning single that scored the first run of Milwaukee’s 5-3 win over the Giants.
William Contreras hit a 435-foot two-run homer to cap a rally.
Freddy Peralta struck out eight and allowed two hits in six scoreless innings.
Blake Perkins followed with a two-run double.
Chourio powered the Brewers’ longest home run of the season, a 449-foot shot, on Tuesday.
Post-Match Reflections: Jackson Chourio expressed gratitude for the opportunity to contribute.
Freddy Peralta reflected on his recent performance, emphasizing his hard work and confidence.
